title: 111_s1426
content: The Act is titled the "National Guard and Reserve Soft Landing Reintegration Act." It allows for retention on active duty after demobilization of reserves following extended deployments in contingency operations or homeland defense missions. The "National Guard and Reserve Soft Landing Reintegration Act" allows for retention on active duty for 90 days after demobilization of reserve members deployed for more than 179 days in contingency operations or homeland defense missions. The "National Guard and Reserve Soft Landing Reintegration Act" allows for retention on active duty for 90 days after demobilization of reserve members deployed for more than 179 days in contingency operations or homeland defense missions. Members on active duty will receive pay and allowances as specified by the Secretary of Defense. The "National Guard and Reserve Soft Landing Reintegration Act" allows for retention on active duty for 90 days after demobilization of reserve members deployed for more than 179 days in contingency operations or homeland defense missions. During this period, members will receive reduced pay and allowances based on their length of retention on active duty. Members can request to be released from active duty after 15 days of being retained. The Act allows for retention on active duty for 90 days after demobilization of reserve members deployed for more than 179 days. Members can request release from active duty after 15 days, subject to approval by an O-5 officer. The Secretary of the military department shall provide counseling and services for reintegration into civilian life, including health evaluations, employment assistance, marriage and family counseling, financial management, and education counseling. The Act allows for retention on active duty for 90 days after demobilization of reserve members deployed for more than 179 days. Counseling and services provided include health evaluations, employment assistance, marriage and family counseling, financial management, education counseling, and benefits information from the Department of Defense and Veterans Affairs. Family members may also participate in counseling. Services are aimed to be provided at convenient locations and in coordination with the Yellow Ribbon Reintegration Program.
